name: exclaim
content:
Add to word list

C2 to say or shout something suddenly because of surprise, fear, pleasure, etc.: [ + speech ] "You can't leave now!" she exclaimed. [ + speech ] "Nonsense!" he exclaimed in disgust.exclaim in She exclaimed in delight upon hearing the news.
More examplesFewer examples"You can't do that!" she suddenly exclaimed.Someone in the audience was heard to exclaim, "He's a bit old to play Romeo!"As we appeared, all muddy and sodden, Mum rushed towards us exclaiming and fussing."Good grief!", he exclaimed, "It's my old mate Tony!"After the show, the girls exclaimed that it was the best thing they'd ever seen.
